artworks.name: The Water Lily Pond
artworks.fact: This work was created as part of a 250 piece Water Lilies series. The paintings were inspired by Monet's flower garden at his home in Giverny, France.

artworks.name: Impression, Sunrise
artworks.fact: This work depicts the port of Le Havre, Monet's hometown. It is credited with inspiring the name of the Impressionist movement.

artworks.name: Olive Trees With Yellow Sky And Sun
artworks.fact: This work is part of a 15 piece Olive Trees series. The paintings were created during van Gogh's stay at an asylum in southern France.

artworks.name: Sunflowers
artworks.fact: This work is part of two Sunflower series with a total of 12 paintings. The paintings were inspired by van Gogh's friend Paul Gauguin.

artworks.name: Portrait of Adele Bloch-Bauer
artworks.fact: This work is also known as The Lady in Gold or The Woman in Gold. The painting was stolen by the Nazis in 1941 and returned to the Bloch-Bauer family in 2006.

artworks.name: Portrait of Fritza Riedler
artworks.fact: Klimt was commissioned to paint this portrait in 1904, during which time he was considered the most prominent portraitist in Vienna.

artworks.name: The Weeping Woman
artworks.fact: This work was part of a series Picasso made in protest to the Spanish Civil War. The model for the painting was Dora Maar, a professional photographer.

artworks.name: The Old Guitarist
artworks.fact: This work was inspired by Picasso's poverty and the suicide of his friend Carlos Casagemas. The melancholy elements in the painting reflect his feelings at the time.

artworks.name: Ophelia
artworks.fact: This work is of Ophelia in Shakespeare's play, Hamlet. She was a favorite subject of Waterhouse.

artworks.name: The Lady Of Shallot
artworks.fact: This work is a representation of the ending of Alfred, Lord Tennyson's poem, The Lady of Shalott. It is one of Waterhouse's most famous works.

artworks.name: Mural
artworks.fact: This work is Pollocks largest, measuring 8ft by 19ft. It was commissioned by Peggy Guggenheim for the long entrance hall of her New York townhouse.

artworks.name: Autumn Rhythm
artworks.fact: This is considered one of Pollock's most notable works. Its original name is Number 30.
